result.execSummary:
The defendant Annette Sanders-Adorno was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 07/24/2015 @ 1:30pm, Br-40
Restitution Hearing scheduled for 05/22/2015 @ 8:30am

miscConds.notes:
To be determined at a hearing

**06-16-15/Rest. Hearing**
Court ordered restitution set in the amount of $328.98; payable to Joseph E., to be paid 1st and foremost.

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2: Due to financial hardship, Court waived all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any domestic abuse surcharge, except mandatory surcharges. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- Firearms/weapons. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

- Supervision by the Mental Health Unit, Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
- Successfully complete Anger Management counseling.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- No Contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to No Violent Contact.
- Pay all supervision fees as determined by the DOC's.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Obtain GED/HSED.

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to Judge Prostasiewicz
for review. os

Defendant Annette Sanders-Adorno not in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Per email from Probation Dept., defendant is currently in absconder status.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court.  Defendant did not appear.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Restituion hearing held.  Court ordered restitution set in the amount of $328.98; payable to Joseph E.; to be paid 1st and foremost.
Case set for restitution hearing.  Counsel left when defendant did not appear.  Restitution hearing rescheduled to 6/16/15 at 1:30.  rmm

Defendant Annette Sanders-Adorno in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for restitution hearing.  Parties do not have all the information that is needed.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Restitution hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Annette Sanders-Adorno in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Annette Sanders-Adorno in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by:   Joseph E. 
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months concurrent in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Supervision by the Mental Health Unit, Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete Anger Management counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Due to financial hardship, Court waived all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any domestic abuse surcharge, except mandatory surcharges.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-Obtain GED/HSED.
-No firearms; weapons.
-Restitution to be determined at a hearing.
.
AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 48 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 48 days time served.  THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Restitution hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Annette Sanders-Adorno not in court, in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and  no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Joseph E.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Annette Sanders-Adorno in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  
Defendant Annette Sanders-Adorno in custody.  
Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40 due to lower pending case (14CM4770).  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
